transcript.speaker: Choose a format
transcript.dialogue: Regular Table Indented Condensed

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Mmm! These watercress sandwiches are splendid!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Do you like them? I made them with extra water.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: So that's the secret!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I've composed some light verse to accompany our reverie. Shall I recite it?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: That would be divine.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: A bug on a rugDrank from a mug.I felt a tug.(pause, squeaks mug)Give me a hug.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I adore the rhyme scheme.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Let us engage in a spirited philosophical debate. Is morality an absolute or a relative societal construct?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: It's absolute. You're either good, or evil.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: There are no absolutes, the cold hand of science has shown us that. (sips from his mug) My friend, it appears we disagree.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Then let us agree to disagree. (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well stated. A toast, to civility and restraint.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: More tea, m'lady?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Why, yes, how lovely. (sips from his mug)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Moltar, where are the cakes? The dainty cakes.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Dainty cakes?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Where are they?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: I bought 'em! I had 'em in the car! I, I swear! Sh- she handed 'em right to me. I, I had the dainty cakes right in the car! Nooooo!!!!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (wakes up, panting) Ooooh, what a nightmare!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (invisos in) Greetings! I'm Space Ghost. Here's the deal. I've got a behind, it's super-heroic, and I'm about to shake it.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I'd rather you didn't.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Why are we even doing this?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Evil villains, stand down from the funk. Tonight, I'm gonna tear it up, and break it down, with my favorite extended dance mixes.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: That still doesn't answer the question.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Come on, Moltar, all the kids are dancin'! (high funky voice, with echo) It's electrifyin'! (end echo) Now put the needle on the record.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (grumbles to himself, throws lever; needle drops to record, dance music plays)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: It's time for my (high voice) Soooooo-looo Dance Party. (neon-style titles superimposed on screen: SOLO DANCE PARTY) Y'all ready for this? (dances at his desk) Come on, come on!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (glares at Space Ghost)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Come on, Zorak, this is outta sight, man!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: You dance like a woman.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (record scratch sound, music stops) I dance like a woman, if she were a man.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Well, you got me there.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I command all viewers to welcome my first guests, Mr.Ice-T and Mr. Ernie-C. Together, they're my first guests.

transcript.speaker: Ice-T
transcript.dialogue: Greetings!

transcript.speaker: Ernie-C
transcript.dialogue: Hello, how are you?

transcript.speaker: Ice-T
transcript.dialogue: What's up, Space?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Space is up, T, way up! And, way out! Observe my outer space jig! Moltar?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (grumbles again, throws lever, needle drops again, more dance music)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (doing funky hand moves) E-lec-tronic, au-to-matic. How d'ya like this action, Ice-T?

transcript.speaker: Ice-T
transcript.dialogue: It's all good, Space baby.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (dancing again) Yeah, they never let me do this in the action show.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I have vanquished you, lizard slavers. And now, behold the pelvic gyrations of my victory boogie. (dance music starts, Space Ghost boogies)

transcript.speaker: Lizard Slaver 1
transcript.dialogue: No, please, not the victory boogie!

transcript.speaker: Lizard Slaver 2
transcript.dialogue: The cosmic gyrations will destroy the ship!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Doin' the butt! Heyyy... pret-tay, pret-tay!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh, Iced Tea, you are a sweet and refreshing beverage.

transcript.speaker: Ice-T
transcript.dialogue: I am very sweet and refreshin'. (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I'm not talkin' about you, I'm speaking in general.

transcript.speaker: Ice-T
transcript.dialogue: That's right.

transcript.speaker: Ernie-C
transcript.dialogue: Very cool, very cool.

transcript.speaker: Ice-T
transcript.dialogue: What's up, Zorak? My man.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (eyes swirling, with eerie sound effects; tries to control Ice-T's mind) (Ice-T! You will hook up Zorak with some fly honeys!)

transcript.speaker: Ice-T
transcript.dialogue: (appears to be in a trance)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Ice-T. Ice-T. Wake up!

transcript.speaker: Ice-T
transcript.dialogue: That was cool, Zorak, that was cool, hit me 'gain, that was cool.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Just remember what I said.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Want me to blast the little pit spawn?

transcript.speaker: Ice-T
transcript.dialogue: That's how you do, Space Ghost, you just go around killin' and blastin' ...

transcript.speaker: Ernie-C
transcript.dialogue: (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Ice-T
transcript.dialogue: Space Ghost, just don't blast us!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Why not? It's electrifyin'.

transcript.speaker: Ice-T
transcript.dialogue: Do Ernie.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh, okay. (aims power bands)

transcript.speaker: Ernie-C
transcript.dialogue: Ho-, ho-, hold...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I'm only playing, I'm only playing. What are you, you're mad at me now.

transcript.speaker: Ernie-C
transcript.dialogue: No, no, I don't even like the word "destructo". (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Free-style for me, Ice Ice baby.

transcript.speaker: Ice-T
transcript.dialogue: You see my name's SG, and the place to be, representin' with Ice-T and Ernie-C.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (raps badly) Why I'm SG, and it's plain to see, that I'm SG, and my name is SG.

transcript.speaker: Ice-T
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) That was cool.

transcript.speaker: Ernie-C
transcript.dialogue: That was interestin'.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (eyes swirling again, with sound effects, etc.) (Just a little mental note...)

transcript.speaker: Ice-T
transcript.dialogue: Hmm?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (Reminding you about those fly honeys.)

transcript.speaker: Ice-T
transcript.dialogue: Zorak was messin' with my brain again, what're you do...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hey, Ice-T, check it, buddy. (dances again, panting, humming to himself. Ice-T, Ernie-C and Zorak stare at him)

transcript.speaker: Ice-T
transcript.dialogue: Come on, Ghost, come on, man, you gotta, you gotta do better'n that.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Don't take that tone of voice with me, young man!

transcript.speaker: Ice-T
transcript.dialogue: Yes, sir.

transcript.speaker: Ernie-C
transcript.dialogue: Yes.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hey, Moltar! Kick it!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (throws lever, rock music plays)

transcript.speaker: Ernie-C
transcript.dialogue: I hear somethin'.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Oooh, this rocks!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hold on, I can't dance to this.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Play it backwards!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: No, don't! Something scary could happen!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (throws lever, music starts playing backwards; a ghost flies out of his monitor) Eaaaaah! A ghost! (runs away)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Moltar, what's goin' on?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (talking to Moltar, who is standing next to his desk) What's wrong?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: I wanna be out here with you.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: He's frightened of ghosts!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (whimpering) Moltar fears nothing! Nothing!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: He fears what he cannot understand.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: That ghost isn't gonna hurt you.

transcript.speaker: Ice-T
transcript.dialogue: Bring him in here so I can smack 'em.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: But... but...

transcript.speaker: Ernie-C
transcript.dialogue: One time.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: See, Mr. T and his friend Ernie aren't afraid of the ghost.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, Moltar, it just wants to possess your soul!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (as ghost flies by) No!!

transcript.speaker: Ice-T
transcript.dialogue: (to ghost) Peace, ghost. (waves)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Get outta here!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: No! Wha!!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (evil laugh)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You don't have to be crazy to work here... (punchline intro music) But it helps! (punchline outro music) Stop it!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (to Moltar, in control room) But I keep telling you, I'm a ghost, you're not afraid of me, are you?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Arggh, no! I hate you, hate and fear are two different things.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (floating, makes "scary" sound) Aaaaaaaaaaaaa! Are you frightened?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Uh, no. I think I just told you, I hate you?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (on control room monitor) Hey, what, are you guys slow dancin' in there? I wanna go home. (monitor shows text:)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (invisos back to desk, lounge music is playing) Yes, as a matter of fact, we were. And speaking of were, please welcome funny man Fred Willard.

transcript.speaker: Fred Willard
transcript.dialogue: (appears on monitor) My name is Fred Willard, and in earth terms, I am an actor, and, uh, I've been in some movies and television series...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Let's talk about your days at "Real People." Now, there's a show!

transcript.speaker: Fred Willard
transcript.dialogue: Oh, yeah, now, now that was fun.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: How did you determine if a person was real or an android?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, did you rip their face off and check their circuitry?

transcript.speaker: Fred Willard
transcript.dialogue: Uh, this is getting a little technical for me...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Then let's change the subject to me. You know, I'm a superhero...

transcript.speaker: Fred Willard
transcript.dialogue: That's right, and I, I, you are a hero, and I always wanted to play a, a hero. And I think, I think I played a hero once, I think I played Batman in a stage revue in Chicago...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I won't have that man's name mentioned on my show! He still owes me for that dinner I bought him at R. J. McGoodtimes. (quietly) I oughta tell everybody he's Bruce Wayne.

transcript.speaker: Fred Willard
transcript.dialogue: Oh dear, okay.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Tansut, you hear that? Batman's Bruce Wayne!

transcript.speaker: Tansut
transcript.dialogue: Wow! You think you know a guy.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (eyes swirling yet again, with sound effects, etc.) (Fred Willard, you will hook Zorak up with some fly...) Ih... Never mind.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Fred, I got a notion to put my butt in motion. Moltar!! (monitor shows text:)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (pulls lever, disco music plays)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (dances again) Come on, Fred, sing along!

transcript.speaker: Fred Willard
transcript.dialogue: I'm game, I'm up for it. (music stops)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (rustling noise) Whaa!!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Moltar! What's happening now?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: The ghost is back! (Ghost flies to Zorak's keyboard pod)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Stop scrunchin' me! This is my work area! (Ghost flies through Zorak & flies off) Hey! You got my soul! Gimme back my soul! (bounces off after ghost)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Say, I'll bet Zorak doesn't have a "ghost" of a chance (punch line music). Get it, Fred?

transcript.speaker: Fred Willard
transcript.dialogue: Sure, sure. Now, we're not gonna be, beamed back to earth without mentioning my movie, are we?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: It's all about you, isn't it, Fred?

transcript.speaker: Fred Willard
transcript.dialogue: Uh... (smiles)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well...

transcript.speaker: Fred Willard
transcript.dialogue: Well, it takes place in this small, uh, midwestern town, and we're a small time amateur theatrical group that puts on... (Zorak walks in front of the camera; Fred continues to talk in the background, but is drowned out by Space Ghost and Zorak)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Back already, Zorak? Did you get your soul back?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (mocking) No, I didn't. Did you get your brain back?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: That's your worst line ever.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Thanks.

transcript.speaker: Fred Willard
transcript.dialogue: ... and we find out this gentleman called Guffman may come to see us from uh, Broadway producers, I think it comes out in January, and I think you'll enjoy it.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (pause) Ah ha!! Now that's an anecdote!

transcript.speaker: Fred Willard
transcript.dialogue: Uh, which one?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (spooky sounds) He's baaaack!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Away with you, spirit! Hang on a minute, Fred.

transcript.speaker: Fred Willard
transcript.dialogue: That's fine, that's fine. I'm in no hurry.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: There's only room for one ghost in this studio, and it's not the ghost that's not me!

transcript.speaker: Fred Willard
transcript.dialogue: Alright.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (blasts ghost with destructo ray; a note flutters to the ground at Space Ghost's feet) Holy Schnikes! That ghost was carrying a note! (picks up note) It says: (sniff) I just wanted to shake it. One time. (sniff) Sincerely, A Ghost.

transcript.speaker: Fred Willard
transcript.dialogue: Oh!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (mock sincerity) If I'd known that, maybe I wouldn't have been so scared.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (distraught) I never got my fly honeys! (gets big anime eyes & cries; his tear sizzles when it hits the ground)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Fred Willard, this is all your fault! I order you to give the ghost a touching eulogy.

transcript.speaker: Fred Willard
transcript.dialogue: Ah! And, um, yes, he's done a lot of wonderful... stuff, am I saying the right thing?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Eh, who cares? Let's dance! Moltar! Hit me with another one of those block rockin' beats!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (pulls lever, disco music plays, monitor shows text:)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (dances again; Fred looks disgusted, then credits roll) Hey! Ho! Hey! Ho! (over and over and over)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: The only thing that scares me more than ghosts is coming to terms with my grief.

transcript.speaker: Tansut
transcript.dialogue: Oh, suck it up, fatty!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (groan)
